title: Could not connect to HTTP Server.
body:
Yeah, so I've been poking around the boards for the last 20 minutes or so and it seems that this issue is becoming more and more prevalent.  Tried connecting to the game server and got the following RADS Error notification:

Could not connect to the HTTP server.  Please check that your Internet connection is enabled and that your firewall is not blocking access.

Funny it should do this considering I was just connected to the Steam servers playing Civ 6... went to check if it was me and go on to the Battle.net servers and ran a Greater Rift just to be sure... no problems.  Turned off WebRoot and Windows Defender and tried to reconnect... no dice.  Made sure to white list the LoL client in my port settings on my modem... big ole negatory.  Deleted/Uninstalled game, attempted to reinstall, can't even do that to download the patches.  So now I'm sitting here with a launcher shell and no game behind it.  Can't wait to see what happens next!

replies.body: This was most likely caused by an external network issue that was affecting a few of our services, login being one of them. This has been resolved, so if you're still having this issue, let me know.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4b5F9zLi,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-12-02T03:09:03.289+0000)
>
> This was most likely caused by an external network issue that was affecting a few of our services, login being one of them. This has been resolved, so if you're still having this issue, let me know.

i stil have this problem

Thanks for the reply Targons!  The issue resolved itself once the external network issue you guys were having was handled.  Within about a half hour of this post as a matter of fact!  Thank you for your service and offer to help!

so yeah i had this and i also had a 1016 error when trying to login to the sight about 30min ago, was thinking of everything i can do to fix it on my end.

basically i ended up just unplugging my modem then replugging it back in to make sure it reset it's self, and just incase, because now i can log in to the client i went back to using the legacy client,( FYI, even if you can get the client to work after a few mins of waiting before launching the client, you may still get a tansfer bug related to the beta client, so i suggest you just reset your modem and launch the legacy client, to be on the safe side.)

hope this helps out

Just so you can see my latest RADS Kernel:

(   USER)[15:40:07.466] RADS::UserKernel::Application::Run: Riot Application Distribution System (c) 2010 Riot Games (version 1.0.0.228)
(   USER)[15:40:07.466] RADS::UserKernel::Application::Run: Running at 15:40:07 on 12/01/2016
(  DEBUG)[15:40:07.466] RADS::UserKernel::Application::Run: Command line: "updateandrun lol_launcher LoLLauncher.exe"
(  DEBUG)[15:40:07.466] RADS::UserKernel::Application::SelfUpdate: Executed from root folder with correct name, not an update.
(  DEBUG)[15:40:07.466] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::HTTPConnection: (http://l3cdn.riotgames.com)
(  DEBUG)[15:40:07.466] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::Connect: (http://l3cdn.riotgames.com)
(  DEBUG)[15:40:07.466] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::GetFile: ("/releases/live/system/rads_user_kernel.exe.version", "E:/RADS/temp\TMP816D.tmp", RETRY, 0x00000000)
(  ERROR)[15:40:12.127] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::GetFile: perform request failed with code 6
(  ERROR)[15:40:12.127] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::GetFile: Retrying after failed attempt 1
(  ERROR)[15:40:13.057] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::GetFile: perform request failed with code 6
(  ERROR)[15:40:13.057] RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::GetFile: Retrying after failed attempt 2
This same thing is happening to me now that the client updated. It won't let me go back to the legacy client and it just keeps making me shut down LoL completely or attempt to restart it...

Yeah I can't even get past the RADS Error dialogue box.  I've run as admin and even poked around trying to follow some of the board connection issue suggestions (deleting certain files, etc.) and nothing worked.  That's when I just uninstalled and redownloaded... whole lotta good that did me though because I'm still getting the same issue.
